name: Dar-us-Sakina
mission: DAR-US-SAKINA IS A 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO INCLUSION OF INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE MUSLIM COMMUNITY OF HOUSTON. OUR PLATFORM IS A SAFE SPACE FOR PEOPLE OF ALL ABILITIES AND THEIR CAREGIVERS. WE INSPIRE THE COMMUNITY TO ABANDON STIGMAS AND EMBRACE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WITH EMPATHY AND RESPECT. TOGETHER, WE ARE BETTER.
theoryOfChange: Dar-us-Sakina outlines its strategic framework through its Mission, Vision, and Values, and details its approach to impact measurement on its 'About Us' page and in its annual reports. The organization fulfills its mission through programming in three key service areas: education, support, and community awareness. Within this framework, they provide diverse opportunities for individuals with disabilities and their families. Their 'Our Impact' section on the website tracks specific metrics such as 478 special needs families registered, 358 caregivers enrolled in support groups, 108 special needs students in Islamic education, 9,660 hours of volunteer service, and 350 community members trained in disability awareness. An annual report further elaborates on their programs, goals (e.g., expanding their Teen Adult program), and the demographics they serve, including percentages for various disabilities.
zakatClaimEvidence: Zakat Program For special needs families in crisis, we are committed to providing comprehensive support through our Zakat Fund. (Source: https://storage.e.jimdo.com/file/46e685bd-42f9-4e42-bec8-dd794366b915/D_AnnualReport2024_R3.pdf)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

score_details.score_summary: Dar-us-Sakina shows good impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance. Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

zakat.claim_evidence: Zakat Program For special needs families in crisis, we are committed to providing comprehensive support through our Zakat Fund. (Source: https://storage.e.jimdo.com/file/46e685bd-42f9-4e42-bec8-dd794366b915/D_AnnualReport2024_R3.pdf)

all_citations.claim: Dar-us-Sakina holds a Charity Navigator score of 93.0/100 and a program expense ratio of 72.2%.
The organization reported total revenue of $540,354 and holds 15.9 months of working capital.
The mission is to provide inclusive opportunities for individuals with disabilities in the Houston Muslim community.
The organization operates specialized programs for teens and adults.
Educational initiatives include the Sakina Sunday School.
The charity tracks metrics such as students receiving Islamic education and community members trained in disability awareness.
Families are supported through a Zakat Fund and specialized enrollment for special needs students.
The organization offers various donation options and is Zakat-eligible.
The Volunteer Enrichment Program provides engagement opportunities for the community.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial health and niche community alignment, balanced against the high resource intensity of its specialized services.
areas_for_improvement: Relatively high cost per beneficiary for capacity-building initiatives
Limited third-party impact data beyond internal annual reports

dimension_explanations.alignment: The charity shows strong alignment for Muslim donors due to its high donor fit and the religious urgency of providing inclusive spaces within the faith community [3][11]. Its track record includes established programs like the Sakina Internship and Volunteer Enrichment Program, which foster long-term community engagement [5][12].
dimension_explanations.impact: Dar-us-Sakina demonstrates moderate impact by focusing on capacity building, training community members in disability awareness and providing Islamic education to students with special needs [9][10]. While the organization maintains a healthy program expense ratio of 72.2%, the specialized nature of its work results in a higher cost per beneficiary compared to broader relief charities [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Dar-us-Sakina empowers individuals with disabilities in the Houston Muslim community through inclusive education and specialized support services.
strengths: High financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 93.0/100
Strong liquidity with 15.9 months of working capital
Efficient fundraising operations spending only $0.13 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: Dar-us-Sakina provides essential services for Muslim individuals with disabilities, offering programs such as the Sakina Sunday School and specialized internships [3][4]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting disability advocacy and community inclusion [10][11].

impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that specialized educational interventions are actually improving the quality of life for students with disabilities.

strengths.detail: The organization holds a <cite id="1">93/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting strong governance and transparency.
Dar-us-Sakina maintains <cite id="1">15.9 months of working capital</cite>, providing a robust safety net for its specialized services.
The charity spends only <cite id="1">$0.04 to raise every $1</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor funds are available for programs.

strengths_deep_dive: Dar-us-Sakina excels in financial stewardship and operational efficiency. According to its <cite id="2">2023 Form 990</cite>, the organization managed <cite id="2">$478,857 in total assets</cite> with minimal liabilities. Its <cite id="1">72.2% independent board</cite> ensures objective oversight of its mission to provide <cite id="9">Islamic education and disability awareness</cite>. The organization's growth is notable, with <cite id="2">contributions reaching $398,320</cite> in the most recent tax year, supported by a <cite id="1">perfect 100 score in both Culture and Leadership</cite> beacons from Charity Navigator.
rich_narrative.summary: Dar-us-Sakina is a specialized non-profit organization dedicated to <cite id="3">empowering individuals with disabilities</cite> within the Houston Muslim community. By providing <cite id="5">inclusive education and specialized support services</cite>, the organization addresses a critical gap in community infrastructure. In the 2023 fiscal year, Dar-us-Sakina reported <cite id="2">total revenue of $540,354</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 24.6%</cite>. The organization operates with high financial integrity, maintaining a <cite id="1">93/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. Their flagship initiatives include the <cite id="4">Sakina Sunday School</cite> and the <cite id="4">Teen Adult Program (TAP)</cite>, which focus on religious education and vocational readiness. Furthermore, the charity is <cite id="11">verified as Zakat-eligible</cite>, specifically serving the <cite id="10">fuqara and masakin</cite> asnaf categories through its dedicated Zakat Fund. With <cite id="1">15.9 months of working capital</cite>, the organization demonstrates exceptional long-term financial stability, ensuring that its specialized programs for <cite id="6">disability awareness and caregiver support</cite> remain resilient against economic fluctuations.
